intro: Eriocaulon diaguissense, commonly known as the Diaguís sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
